description: False willow (Baccharis angustifolia) is an amazing plant species, due to its drought tolerance, longevity, and hardiness. It's native to the desert regions of both South and North America, and its roots usually reach down several feet in search of valuable moisture and nutrients. It is highly adaptive to various environments and can survive in saline, sandy, rocky, and loamy soils, and even thrive in areas with intense heat and cold. In addition, it serves as a great landscaping or ornamental plant due to its attractive light green leaves and yellow flowers and seeds. False willow is easy to cultivate and care for and is known to help reduce environmental pollutants, making it an environmentally-friendly choice.
